PW Sports Wagering -- Authorize Sports Wagering Activities - Act 215, 2020
Race.SummaryText: PROPOSITION TO AUTHORIZE SPORTS WAGERING ACTIVITIES.
Race.FullText: Shall sports wagering activities and operations be permitted in the parish of Lafayette?

Race.SpecificTitle: Parishwide Proposition -- .25 Mills Rededication - PC - 5 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), be authorized to rededicate the proceeds hereafter received by the Parish from the levy and collection of .25 mills currently collected by the Parish and allocated to providing, establishing, operating, improving, and expanding public facilities and programs to foster and enhance the Parish's culture, recreation, entertainment, arts, tourism and their respective economies pursuant to the Public Health Millage Rededication Proposition approved at an election held on November 18, 2017 (the "Tax") (an estimated $563,929.74 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), to be levied through the year 2025, for the following purposes: (i) 0.175 mills collected, dedicated, and used for fire protection in Lafayette Parish and all costs affiliated thereto; and (ii) 0.075 mills collected, dedicated, and used for the purpose of constructing, improving, and maintaining roads and bridges in Lafayette Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Consolidated School Dist. No. 1 -- 5 Mills Renewal - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Consolidated School District No. 1 Proposition
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated School District No. 1 of the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a five (5) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in said District (an estimated $11,750,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2022 and ending with the year 2031, for the purpose of improving, operating and maintaining the public school buildings for said District?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Scott -- 1% S&U Tax - M&CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Scott Proposition
(New Sales Tax)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Scott, State of Louisiana (the "City"), pursuant to authority adopted in the 2020 Regular Session of the Louisiana Legislature (the "Act"), and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect an additional one percent (1%) (the "Tax") ($2,400,000 is expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year) upon the sale at retail, use, lease or rental, consumption, and storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the City, all as defined by law, beginning April 1, 2021 and ending March 31, 2031, with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) to be divided equally between the police and fire departments and used to provide funding for emergency services within the City in the manner provided by law?
